intro: Machaeranthera shastensis var. eradiata, commonly known as the Shasta lomatium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It has a taproot system that allows it to survive in nutrient-poor soils. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
